value:
Humans are forged in the fires of
adversity. So I learned by living hand
to mouth, war to war.

The Valmese empire assailed my
beloved Chon'sin, robbing its people
of all but our hearts and souls.

To the devotees of Teaism, even a
lifetime of study is not enough. Not to
worry, though—I'm not one of them.

Though adversity may smother it, the
flame of compassion is never dead in
those who seek a brighter future.

I truly believe in the path I walk,
though it diverges from my brother's.
I shall soldier ever onward...

I am Say'ri, Princess of Chon'sin.
I offer a gesture of solidarity on
behalf of $Nf.
A clean cut! My form is without fault!

Mastery comes not in a single day.
I am satisfied with steady growth.
P'raps I have strayed from the path...

You have my thanks. I shall devote
myself to mastering this technique.

I am Say'ri, Princess of Chon'sin. My
blade gives no quarter. I shall excise
the tendrils of chaos at the root.

Permit me ask you a question, trivial
though it may sound. To your eye do
I seem, ah...stronger?$k$pYou see, though my royal upbringing
in Chon'sin was a joy, it was also, in a
certain sense, limiting.$k$pMeeting the great samurai of Hoshido
and proud fighters like the Greil
Mercenaries has opened my eyes.$k$pSparring with them, mentally as well
as physically, has rekindled the
warrior's passion in my soul.$k$pThough the path ahead be long and
arduous, I will persevere. For my
fellow Heroes, and for you! I swear it!
はあっ
いざ！
くっ…
これしき…！
Prepare yourself!
I shall dispatch you!
I take no pleasure in this!
An imperfect defense!
Yen'fay... Why...
ふっ
I am called Say'ri, and I fight with the Resistance against the Valmese Empire.
Fie, is this the proper approach to conversation among your people?
My homeland, Chon'sin, has quite a unique culture. I shall be happy to expound upon the differences, if it please you.
The Voice is wise beyond my ken. I am humbled to know that she considers me a friend.
'Tis my joy and privilege to put my study of the way of the sword toward the benefit of Askr.
I do not understand your thinking, Brother. Fie, why must you do the bidding of the Empire?
I, Say'ri, shall cut down your fiercest enemies. This I swear.
At once.
Aye...
Into the fray.
